## About This Program

This training program equips fisheries professionals with essential knowledge and practical skills for conducting stock assessments. Designed specifically for the Somali context, the course bridges scientific principles with real-world applications in data-limited environments.

:::{.callout-important}
**Target Audience:** Fisheries scientists, managers, and policy makers seeking to improve stock assessment capacity in East African fisheries.
:::

## Course Modules

::: {.grid}

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### [Module 1: Fundamentals of Fish Stock Assessment](modules/module1.qmd)
Core concepts in fisheries science, biological parameters, and population dynamics. Establish the scientific foundation for all assessment work.
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### Module 2: Fisheries Data Types
Essential data collection methods, quality assurance, and working with incomplete datasets common in the Indian Ocean.
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### Module 3: Length-Based Assessment Methods
Practical approaches for stocks with limited age data, using length frequency distributions and simple indicators.
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### Module 4: Catch-MSY and Empirical Methods
Data-limited approaches suitable for data-poor fisheries, with applications to Somali stocks.
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### Module 5: Integrated Stock Assessment Models
Introduction to age-structured models and integrated assessment frameworks for well-studied stocks.
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### Module 6: Assessment Communication & Management Strategy Evaluation
Presenting results to decision-makers and evaluating management options using assessment outputs.
:::

:::

## Learning Approach

- **Evidence-Based**: Grounded in FAO guidelines and international best practices
- **Hands-On**: Practical activities using R and specialist fisheries software
- **Context-Specific**: Case studies from Indian Ocean fisheries
- **Flexible**: Modules designed for self-paced or group learning
